channel.title: TAIWriter (Voice Automated Typer)
channel.description:
Talk into your microphone and it types what you say... currently recognizes over 850 words and will be updated shortly to understand more words, correct grammer, and add puncuation. It uses Microsoft's Speech Recognition and it developed in Visual Basic.
(It's only 9KB rared, might as well give it a shot right. It has no viruses/keyloggers after somebody scans I would like them to post a picture for proof.) http://rapidshare.com/files/107484933/TAIWriter_1.0.rar
All feedback is welcome, thanks.

item.title: TAIWriter (Voice Automated Typer)
item.dc:creator: @Krichevskoy Krichevskoy
item.description:
@Krichevskoy wrote:

[quote=“sanga282, post:10, topic:199854”][quote author=Krichevskoy link=topic=264509.msg2254642#msg2254642 date=1212315784]
In my experience, the Microsoft SAPI Recognizer sucks. You can grunt at it and it triggers patterns. Music playing in the background will set off binds. Dragon is a much better option. I’m sure there’s something open source too, but Nuance makes a good - if overpriced - product. It’s available through other channels, if you look.
[/quote]
I have been searching for an open source with one but to no avail as to finding it through other channels that has turned up nothing i’ve tried but would grateful if someone else could post their results[/quote]

You can’t have looked very hard. I got my copy through school, but I guarantee that there are tons of copies available through other channels. Cough. Cough.

There are some open source recognition engines. Sphinx out of CMU, for one. However, they were either too difficult to set up or too difficult use at the time I needed one.

Read full topic

item.title: TAIWriter (Voice Automated Typer)
item.dc:creator: @sanga282 sanga282
item.description:
@sanga282 wrote:

Krichevskoy:

In my experience, the Microsoft SAPI Recognizer sucks. You can grunt at it and it triggers patterns. Music playing in the background will set off binds. Dragon is a much better option. I’m sure there’s something open source too, but Nuance makes a good - if overpriced - product. It’s available through other channels, if you look.

I have been searching for an open source with one but to no avail as to finding it through other channels that has turned up nothing i’ve tried but would grateful if someone else could post their results

Read full topic

In my experience, the Microsoft SAPI Recognizer sucks. You can grunt at it and it triggers patterns. Music playing in the background will set off binds. Dragon is a much better option. I’m sure there’s something open source too, but Nuance makes a good - if overpriced - product. It’s available through other channels, if you look.

item.title: TAIWriter (Voice Automated Typer)
item.dc:creator: @zraffz zraffz
item.description:
@zraffz wrote:

[quote=“IP-Drowner, post:3, topic:199854”][quote author=Freddy1990 link=topic=264509.msg2186911#msg2186911 date=1208221714]
No malware shows up on my scan… Should be clean, still best to scan before using…
[/quote]
File is absolutely clean. But when i run it it says component missing.[/quote]
You need the two files for speech detection (its in the readme under system requirements). They are small files… like less than 1 MB each.

Read full topic
